ygData.subject: Re: Stupid crawl problems:  User-Agent and From
ygData.msgSnippet: Isn t there always a + in front of the user agent, like (+http://www.netarkivet.dk/) kaisa ... but I ... Now ... see ... is ...

Isn't there always a + in front of the user agent, like
(+http://www.netarkivet.dk/)

kaisa

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Lars Clausen <lc@s...> wrote:
> I'm trying to make a crawl to gather some articles about us today,
but I
> can't get Heritrix 0.10.0 to accept my User-Agent and From fields. 
Now
> I know other people have been running them, so it must work, but I
see
> no clue abot what goes wrong.  The relevant part of the crawl order
is
> 
> <map name="http-headers">
> <string name="user-agent">linux-heritrix/0.10.0
(http://www.netarkivet.dk/)</string>
> <string name="from">lc@s...</string>
> </map>
> 
> and the error message is
> 
> A fatal InitializationException occured when loading job:
> You must set the User-Agent and From HTTP header values to
acceptable strings. 
>  User-Agent: [software-name](+[info-url])[misc]
>  From: [email-address]
> :
org.archive.crawler.framework.exceptions.FatalConfigurationException:
unacceptable user-agent or from
> 
> I tried with http://www.netarkivet.dk or www.netarkivet.dk as URL.
> 
> For future users, it would be nice if a) the little pop-up helps
show an
> example of accepted style, and/or b) the error message showed what
> Heritrix got and found offending.
> 
> -Lars
